intro: Cyrtandra cerea, commonly known as the white-flowered cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Cyrtandra cerea is adapted to moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. It plays a significant role in the ecological diversity of Hawaiian ecosystems.
